com.bluegosling.concurrent.scheduler

Interface ScheduledTask<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of value returned upon completion of the task
    All Superinterfaces:
    Awaitable, Cancellable, Comparable<Delayed>, Delayed, FluentFuture<V>, FluentScheduledFuture<V>, Future<V>, com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<V>, com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableScheduledFuture<V>, ScheduledFuture<V>

    public interface ScheduledTask<V>
extends FluentScheduledFuture<V>
    The type of ScheduledFuture returned by submissions to a ScheduledTaskManager. This extension provides various utility methods as well as access to the ScheduledTaskDefinition for which the task was created.

    A ScheduledTask basically represents a single invocation of a ScheduledTaskDefinition.

    • Method Detail

      • taskDefinition

        ScheduledTaskDefinition<V> taskDefinition()
        Returns the task definition for which this task was created.
        Returns:
        the task's definition

      • isStarted

        boolean isStarted()
        Returns whether the scheduled task has begun executing or not.
        Returns:
        true if the task has begun executing (including if it's already finished); false otherwise

      • scheduledStartTimeMillis

        long scheduledStartTimeMillis()
        Returns the scheduled start time of this invocation, in milliseconds. This is measured as milliseconds elapsed since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
        Returns:
        the scheduled start time of this invocation

      • actualStartTimeMillis

        long actualStartTimeMillis()
        Returns the actual start time of this invocation, in milliseconds. This is measured as milliseconds elapsed since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
        Returns:
        the actual start time of this invocation
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the task has not actually started yet

      • finishTimeMillis

        long finishTimeMillis()
        Returns the actual end time of this invocation, in milliseconds. This is the time the task either completed normally or the time it aborted due to thrown exception.
        Returns:
        the end time of this invocation
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the task not yet completed
